Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: The range of ideas, research methods and approaches to scholarship, critical reflection, and creative work in the humanities.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: The range of ideas, research methods and approaches to scholarship, critical reflection, and creative work in the humanities with honors content.

HUM2210 - Studies in Culture: Ancient to.name: HUM2210 - Studies in Culture: Ancient to 17th Century

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: An interdisciplinary, multicultural study of the arts and sciences, focusing on ancient civilizations and the cultural heritage stemming from them.

HUM2230 - Studies in Culture: 17th Centu.name: HUM2230 - Studies in Culture: 17th Century to Present

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: An interdisciplinary, multicultural study of the arts and sciences focusing on modern civilizations and their contributions to the Global Village.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Multicultural study of Philosophy and the arts of the 20th century.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Multicultural study of Philosophy and the arts of the modern period.

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: HUM 2210    and HUM 2230    and Junior standing.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Interdisciplinary exploration of personal and public memory, focusing on the significance of memory and testimony for our sense of self, family, community, culture, and nation.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Studies the confluence of diverse cultures making up North America in the Information Age, focusing on complete primary sources in philosophy, literature, visual arts and music.

HUM3326 - Theories of Sex and Gender in.name: HUM3326 - Theories of Sex and Gender in Humanities

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Historical and contemporary theories of sex and gender relevant in interdisciplinary Humanities.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: An interdisciplinary survey of the cultures of India, China, and Japan, concentrating on their traditional art, literature, religion, philosophy, and music.

HUM3402 - East Asian Folklore and Popula.name: HUM3402 - East Asian Folklore and Popular Culture

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Interdisciplinary course explores the way of living in the geographical and/or conceptual area generally known as "East Asia" within the folkloric and popular culture discourses.

HUM3419H - Honors Islamic Thought and Cu.name: HUM3419H - Honors Islamic Thought and Culture

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: HUM 2230   , or REL 2300, and Consent of Honors.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: The development of Islamic thought and culture, concentrating on religion, jurisprudence, philosophy, science and art with special focus on perception of Islam in Western literature and scholarship. With Honors content.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Contemporary art, culture, and philosophy in selected African countries.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Development of Ancient Greek thought and culture with emphasis on philosophy, religion, literature and art.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Development of Medieval thought and culture with emphasis on Philosophy, Religion, Literature and Art.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Ideas in cultures of Latin America and Caribbean basin as expressed in arts, architecture, music, philosophy, religion, literature and film.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Analysis of Latinx identity formation, the arts (literary and visual cultural expression), and epochs of social change in the U.S. from colonization to the present.

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: Humanities Major with any prior HUM course or C.I.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Research skills for the humanities, including methodologies, writing techniques, essay structuring, formatting, and methods for citing references and constructing bibliographies.

HUM3805 - Critical Theory in the Humanit.name: HUM3805 - Critical Theory in the Humanities

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Theories of interpreting technologies, texts, and practices, with emphasis on film, visual/performing arts, music, religion, and philosophy.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Provides an introduction to major themes, theories, and historiography from the field of Critical Race Theory.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Investigation of the application of digital tools to humanities questions, and to questions about contemporary life.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: The search for order and form in the arts of various times and cultures. Concerns reason, structure, objectivity, harmony. Open to all Juniors and Seniors.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Traditional and contemporary theories of performance with a focus on linguistic performatives, bodily and virtual performances, self-identity, and the politics of performance.

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: Junior standing and any HUM course or C.I.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Exploration of race as it intersects with gender, sexuality, ability, and other variables, in the production, consumption, and technical reprepresentation from dating apps to social robotics.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Phenomenological, symbolic, constructivist, and determinist approaches to personal and social place and space.

HUM4459 - American Cultural Studies in H.name: HUM4459 - American Cultural Studies in Humanities

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Theories of culture intersecting race, class, gender, migration, ability, and national identity in North America.

HUM4823 - Queer Theory in the Humanities.name: HUM4823 - Queer Theory in the Humanities

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Developments in queer theory. Challenge to research by scholars, activists, performers, and visual artists.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Interdisciplinary overview of postcolonial philosophy, literature, film, art and cultural theory.

HUM4931 - Key Figures in the Humanities.name: HUM4931 - Key Figures in the Humanities & Cultural Studies

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Study of a central Humanities/Cultural Studies figure's work, influences, reception, and effect.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Capstone course on research, developing effective oral and written communication skills.

HUM4934 - Key Concepts in Humanities & C.name: HUM4934 - Key Concepts in Humanities & Cultural Studies

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Study of the development, meaning, and implications of a central concept in the Humanities and Cultural Studies.
